name: Cajun Blackened Redfish
author: M. Alario
summary: Delicious, quick and easy dish to prepare!  Best when caught fresh, but can use frozen.  Made this recipe up when I was about 14, still it is one of my favorites!!!
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
In a medium saucepan, melt the butter on low heat; cool to room temperature
Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, combine the cayenne pepper, black pepper, lemon pepper, garlic powder and salt
Dip the filets into the melted butter, then coat with the seasoning mixture
In a large skillet over high heat, sear fish on each side for 2 minutes or until slightly charred
Place in a 11x7 inch baking dish and pour the Italian dressing onto each filet
Cover baking dish and bake in a preheated oven for 30 minutes or until flaky and tender
